name: 'The Last Hurrah' Online Trivia | 'West Wing' - Season 7 | 10 Questions

questions.text: When Vinick was reading his morning paper and drinking his coffee, what was written on his mug?
questions.explanation:
Vinick for President.

	Vinick was sitting in a chair in his living room reading 'The Washington Post' story. Beside his chair was his black coffee mug which had 'Vinick for President' written on it in red letters.

questions.text: At 3 o'clock, when Helen Santos was supposed to be meeting the decorator, to what room did Margaret send her?
questions.explanation:
Oval Office.

	Margaret and CJ were working on something at her desk when Helen Santos walked in and said she had a 3 o'clock with the decorator. Margaret directed her to the Oval Office and Helen was awe struck when she walked around the room. The decorator told her they had a budget of $200,000 to work with and then showed her the sketches for the children's rooms.

questions.text: What two positions did President-Elect Santos offer Vinick?
questions.correct: Vice President or Secretary of State
options: Secretary of State or Deputy Chief of Staff
Vice President or Secretary of Defense
questions.explanation:
Vice President or Secretary of State.

	After calling Vinick into the OEOB the first time, President-Elect Santos offered Vinick the Vice Presidency. The second time Vinick was called to the OEOB, he was offered Secretary of State.

questions.text: President-Elect Santos and his wife decided to live apart until the kids were out of school in June.
questions.explanation:
False.

	After hearing what their street would be turned into by the Secret Service, President-Elect Santos and Helen decided that she and the kids would move to Washington after the Inauguration in January.

questions.text: What was the name of Miranda Santos' secret service agent?
questions.explanation:
Linda.

	Ron Butterfield introduced Peter and Miranda to their Secret Service Agents, Kevin and Linda, while the kids were in their dad's office.

questions.text: 'Who's going to tell him the campaign is over' was a statement made about whom?
questions.explanation:
Vinick.

	Vinick was talking to Senators and Congressmen who helped during the campaign and was scheduling meetings as if her were still campaigning for President.

questions.text: How many schools did the Santos' look at for their kids to attend when they moved to Washington?
questions.explanation:
4.

	While in the limo, Helen mentioned that she told the scheduler that they were going to visit three schools, but at the last minute President-Elect Santos wanted to look at a public school for the kids to attend. He was afraid that going into a private school would turn them into snobs.

questions.text: Did Vinick know that President Bartlet and President-Elect Santos had played good cop/bad cop with President Lien?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Vinick told President-Elect Santos that he knew about the good cop/bad cop ploy with President Lien because Vinick knew Santos wouldn't be reckless enough to go against President Bartlet in foreign affairs.

questions.text: If Vinick turned down President-Elect Santos' offer of Vice President, who was the position going to?
questions.explanation:
Baker.

	President-Elect Santos said in the beginning of the episode that his choice for Vice President was Baker even though he offered the job to to Vinick.

questions.text: Vinick accepted the second job offer that President-Elect Santos offered him.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After speaking to Sheila and Bob, Vinick went back to the OEOB and accepted the second job offer President-Elect Santos offered him, although he made a point of noting that he wouldn't go to any Democratic parties or campaign events.
